comments.body: What would it be used for?
It would be used for purely entertainment, not much purpose i guess. Maybe adding effects to the tea like potions in a way to affect the player's pvp or exploring adventures.
Mojang won't add any manufactured or modern products, for example, kettles and drinkable tea.
Maybe it could be made with tea leaves (New item) x1, Honey bottles x1, and water bottles x2. I think that would work.
Maybe you can brew the leaves in a brewing stand? It could give you a slight speed boost because caffeine,

I think that would be a great idea! I would love to see tea in game. Also, maybe the implementation of crushed/cubed ice to make iced tea, with the edition of an ice crusher to craft the ice in the first place. Also, cups. and maybe lemonade.
Please yes. PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE YES. Over campfires, or just counter-top, cast-iron teapots to brew tea in. Give us Jasmine, Himalayan White, Jade Green, and Oolong. PLEAAASSEEEE D:

The WHY here is important- You need to edit this to tell them the WHY. Which, in my case, is because I really REALLY love playing around and building things, living in Taverns and Inns that I build, teashops and restaurants. PLEASE recognize our need Mojang!
We should be able to also brew flowers that already exist into tea. Blue Orchid Tea, anyone??

To help find the "why/mechanical purpose" for your idea, I think dandelion tea as a way to heal/prevent cold damage would be an excellent addition.

In the upcoming Caves update, I heard that there may be a possibility to take cold damage unless wearing leather armor. I have seen dandelions growing under top snow in snowy biomes, so I think they could be used to craft a tea that gives a temporary effect protecting against or healing cold damage. That way it gives the tea a useful reason to exist besides being purely aesthetic (though I would be happy with that too).

Dandelion tea is already a real drink, and it could be crafted using a bottle of water, honey (maybe), and a roasted dandelion (maybe you need to put the dandelion in the smoker/furnace first). This also makes it so no new plants need to be added to the game. I think a tea kettle and a teacup would be fun additions as well, maybe crafted from clay bricks like flowerpots or iron ingots.

Instead of posting a new idea, I'd like to add onto this, as I also thought adding tea would be a great idea. Tea would be harvested from some kind of tea plant as tea leaves, and could have many applications.

 - Potions: Tea leaves could be a potion ingredient. For example, Chamomile tea could be added, which allows the player to sleep during the day (useful if you need to skip to night). Caffeinated tea could possibly prevent phantoms from spawning that night (if you can't sleep or need it to be night). It could also be used for some kind of speed boost or other effect.

 - Food item: Chai tea with milk and honey is one of my favorite teas, and because milk and honey already exist in game (as well as water) it makes the recipe easy to add. It would be a basic food item, though it could also possibly give one of the effects listed above if it isn't added as a potion ingredient.

 - Other: Tea has many other properties, such as for calming someone or as a medicine. This could be a great opportunity for Minecraft to teach players about tea use around the world, which I know has been a thing with a lot of the newer features added. I also really love boba tea, a tea drink with tapioca pearls at the bottom that are eaten with the drink, though I haven't thought of how they could be added to the game and be useful. Thought I'd mention them at least.

Feel free to let me know if you think of other uses for tea, and I'm glad that other people have thought of this idea as well!

Tea is needed, because in Minecraft there are only 2-3 drinks from reality, and the mechanics of cooking need to be developed, plus motivation to explore for different types of tea. What if a traveling merchant buys different types of tea?
I mean, all I can say is PLEASE YES.
I want a lock so bad! I'm sick of villagers coming into my house and sleeping in my bed
I like the idea but I would prefer the use of actual keys instead of iron ingots.
that would be fun for servers but in survival i dont see the use for it but it is a good idea
Yeah or maybe a door and a key
Functional bookshelves might be too much for mojang, we don't want to overwhelm them, let's just stick with the variations in bookshelves.

My thoughts on bookshelves.

1) Bookshelves should come in all wood varients. Maybe a Spruce Village would have Spruce Bookshelves

2) Having inventories has potential to bring better loot to villages. There might be a small chance that the library has enchanted books in it ike a stronghold.

3) Enchanting: Having 4 Power one books around the enchantment table (in the bookshelves) your almost guaranteed a Power 4 book. This would be a lot cheaper than combining books in an anvil and adds a new layer to enchanting, a part of Minecraft that has not been updated in a while

I would suggest another way for easing the task of findind the slime chunks: this is to make some blocks inside slime chunks somekinda slimy. Probably only inside the slime spawn y-levels. These could be done with some adjusted texture to those usual blocks (green slime above the usual texture). These could be either separate blocks (slimy versions), or the original ones in terms of drop. Probably having a chance to drop a slime ball on destruction, like with gravel and flint.

AFAIK currently the only relatively reliable way to find a slime chunk on purpose is to dig a huge area in the proper Y-level and wait for the slimes to spawn occasionally. I find this to be a too labor intensive for such an essential item as a slime balls.

Adding slimy blocks to slime chunks would ease the task of finding the slime chunk.
It should be part of the debug info menu

I suggest adding a new Item to help find slime chunks. 

  • A compass surrounded in slimeballs within the crafting table (requires you to find Slimes in order to find their "nest" or "den")
  • Compass points to the (northeast?) corner of the chunk. It will guide you to the closest one.
  • The item itself could look like a slimey compass or something similar.
  • Perhaps a new block could be found in slime chunks as well. "Slimystone" No variants necessary. If that is desired, I am for it. It can also be crafted with a slimeball and a stone.

I really think having a way to find Slime Chunks in game would be graciously amazing!
we can also have it so that instead of a slime chunk, it could be a slime cave

either a a place on the debug screen or a slime cave like they are suggesting

Atm no one is allowed large building projects on servers the seed is not given out on, so that people can control weather large projects are allowed it can have a /gamerule toggle and when you set up the world you can toggle it off or on
tribal hunters used them to hunt prey in the jungles of Asia.

I love this! I think that if this were implemented, it would be fun to only be able to dye saddles either light brown, dark brown, or black, but have saddle blankets that could be dyed any color and look similar to llama carpets (I already made a suggestion for the saddle blankets that is currently pending publication). Or maybe the dyed saddles are two tone, where the base color is light brown, dark brown, or black, and the secondary color is any color the player chooses.

This should be revisited now that Camels exist, would be neat of them to add trims to them as-well. Making horses, striders, camels, and pigs more customizable, or to have matching armor with your favorite travel pal.

I think there should be some sort of tool for this, because it can‚Äôt just be a light source. I suggest some sort of miner helmet, or maybe a full set of armor and tools!

 

Other than that, you got my vote!

I like the idea, so I voted for it, but I think this ore could be found differently. The ore could only be found in the End Outer Islands, or a specific biome in the End (or the Overworld) that has this ore. I love anything and everything about new cool biomes and game challenges (like finding a brand new ore)

I think this would make more sense as a variant on terracotta.  Maybe it's terracotta placed in a 2x2 and makes polished terracotta.  This would be almost the same texture, just with borders like polished andesite.  Smelt this polished terracotta and you would get a polished glazed terracotta that is a pure color (rather than the red shift of regular terracotta) with the same tile border.  It would have the same slime resistant properties of normal glazed terracotta.
Just use polished andesite, quartz, or smooth stone.
Bilbo Baggins, I think you missed the part where the suggested tiles are available in all of the colors.
Oops.  I think terracotta makes more sense, in that case.

I was thinking of just using terracotta. You would get a crafting table, and then you would have 4 white terracottas in a diamond shape, and 5 more in a color of your choice, forming a checkerboard pattern. The result would be 8 ceramic tiles. Think of the look to be similar to dark prismarine but with a white and colored checkerboard.

What do you think?
Maybe tiles should just be smelted regular terracotta since its the only terracotta without a glazed varient.

As for floating, lava has a high density and high consistency so it would probably actually sink kind of like quicksand or the terminator in that lava scene.

Way to op.  Plus, there is no real reason for adding it other than being op and looking cool.  That is what mods are for.  There are far better ways of looking cool in Minecraft.
I think this is a good idea, just think of it. Swinging your sword and when you hit a mob, lightning strikes on the mob you hit. That would be pretty sick

If there were days of the week too, then you could know when to pretend to go to school in Minecraft.

My sons and I have been discussing seasons. Which got us talking about calendars. What about a clock in the centre with paper all around for a calendar that you can put on a wall with an item frame. You can calculate the seasons from there. But also have a pop up when you reach a seasonal equinox. Just a thought.
It is a very good idea, and depending on the stage of the year, the weather changes.

I believe that trimming should be a "reforging" of weapons to improve some characteristics to the detriment of others. For example, reforging a sword into a saber or sickle, which will change the attack speed and damage.
Or adding a visor to a helmet will increase protection but reduce visibility.

yess even if its not that many (since weapons are way less pixels), it would be really useful. I am currently tinkering around making a data pack and noticed how amazing the armour trims are to tell the player, what kind of protection the enemy has. I wish I could do the same with weapons (indicating things like flame with a red trim etc)
